oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Troy Avenue Historic District: residential area
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Staff at MTSU Center for Historic Preservation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of a Troy Avenue residence in Dyersburg, Tennessee.

Located in Dyersburg, Tennessee, the Troy Avenue Historic District consists of properties on the west side of the street between 700 and 1400 Troy Avenue. This neighborhood developed as a result of nineteenth century commercial growth in Dyersburg. The majority of the buildings in the residential district were constructed from 1890 through 1930. The oldest documented house remaining on Try Avenue is the Latta House at 947 Troy, which dates to 1852 and was listed independently on the National Register of Historic Places in 1978. The Troy Avenue Historic District grew up around the Latta House as an exclusive upper-middle class residential neighborhood for the town's new elite which emerged during the economic boom from 1880 to 1930.
